note.p: Birth: Magheragall, County Antrim, Ulster (11 July 1857)
Death: Holywood, County Down, Ulster (19 May 1942)
Research Field: Theoretical physics
Education: Royal Belfast Academical Insitution
Queens's University Belfast, BA, MA;
St John's College Cambridge for mathemtical Tripos. Graduated 1880 as Senior Wrangler (top First Class student) and first Smith's Prizeman.

Career: Fellow of St John's College, Cambridge; University and College Lecturer in Mathematics; Senior Wrangler, 1880; Professor of Natural Philosophy Queen's College, Galway 1880-1885; Lecturer, St John's College Cambridge 1885; Lucasian Professor of Mathematics, Cambridge 1903-1932; Fellow of the Royal University of Ireland; Examiner in Mathematics at the University of London
Member of London Mathematical Society from 1884, Council Member 1887-1912; Vice President 1890, Treasurer 1892-1914, President 1914; awarded the De Morgan Medal 1914
Honorary degrees from Dublin, Oxford, Belfast, Glasgow, Aberdeen, Birmingham, St. Andrews, Durham and Cambridge Universities.
Member of Royal Irish Academy, American Academy of Arts and Sciences, and Accademia dei Lincei
MP for University of Cambridge 1911-1922
Honours: Kt 1909
Membership: Fellow
Election Date: 2/06/1892
Medals/Prizes: Royal Medal 1915; Copley Medal 1921
Lectures: Bakerian 1909
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; DSB
